{"step_by_step_thinking": "Enamel is the hard, outer layer of the tooth that protects the inner layers. It can form a chemical bond with certain dental materials. Composites, which are often used for fillings, can bond with enamel. Direct filling resins, which are also used for fillings, can bond with enamel as well. Polycarboxylate cements, which are used for cementing crowns and bridges, can also bond with enamel. BIS-GMA resins in pit and fissure sealants, which are used to prevent tooth decay, can also bond with enamel.", "answer_choice": "A, B, C, D"}
